review.reviewBody: I live on the Texas Coast and humidity is high all summer. This shirt does a great job of keeping me dry. It’s light and soft too.
review.name: Wicking shirt

review.reviewBody:
Wow,

Bought this shirt for an upcoming trip to northern Italy.  It was hot, 90-95 the first 7 days.  I Brough a ton of clothing but the Tahoe Sun Shirt was my goto shirt, superior sun protection, comfortable, fits well, breaths great.   Most everyday ended with the shirt being washed in a small sink, hung to dry and worn the next day.   

My wife is jealous and wants one for herself.  Like all BC clothing that I have bought over years its very well made and worth the money!  Another KEEPA.

Steve
Bowdoinham, Maine
review.name: MY GOTO SHIRT FOR HOT SUNNY DAYS

review.reviewBody: I looked at the Tahoe based on a recommendation by my Gearhead, Ashleigh.  As usual, she was right on with this one.  The shirt is lightweight, breathable, and fits well.  I'm 5'10", 180lbs and the Medium fit me great.  The small, sleeve logo is a nice add that doesn't scream branding at you.  Bought for daily runs, but it is clear this shirt can be used for any Spring, Summer, or Fall outdoor activity.  Highly recommended.
review.name: Fantastic performance shirt

review.reviewBody: Very poorly made, unraveling at the hems after 2 wears. Caution to others purchasing in store while traveling, even with a defective product you need to return to the store to exchange/return. Online customer service can't help. So if you don't live near a store like me, you are stuck with it...
review.name: Absolute garbage

review.reviewBody: I really like this shirt, wear it to the gym frequently. I have the white one as well and you can’t see my nipples through it so not sure what’s happening with the other reviewer.
review.name: Love this shirt

review.reviewBody: Great feeling shirt but dude I can see my big pink nips from mars with this on. Backcountry please consider making the white color t shirt a bit more opaque.
review.name: Nipple advertiser

name: Tahoe Sun Short-Sleeve Crew - Men's

review.reviewBody: Mtn House, as usual, very good. Other vendors are nowhere thr quality.
review.name: Very tasty

review.reviewBody: I ordered & it came quickly prices were good & the food is good very good company to order from.
review.name: What’s not to like

review.reviewBody: This is how I like to start my day.  The 2 1/2 Servings in this pouch is more then my wife and I could finish for breakfast.  This original recipe is great.
review.name: Delicious, very filling

review.reviewBody: This is the gold standard of freeze dried breakfast. Peak skillet is not nearly as good and honestly Peak is on the bland side of flavor and they overload their meal with cheap filler (lots of potatoes). I really want to tell there is meat and protein in my meals and I can definitely tell Mountain House hits it. The protein content of Peak skillet is a darn lie. Mountain House hits it all.
review.name: Gold Standard

review.reviewBody: I've never had nor heard of your company or your products before, my purchases were solely based on the highly recommended reviews of all the products I bought. I have not tried them yet, will be using for emergency situations if they arise & will definitely review them once I've eaten them!
review.name: Based On Reviews

review.reviewBody: The food is flavorful and filling.  The only reason why I rated it 4 stars is the texture.  I can't get past the lack of crisp on the hash browns.  None the less I purchased.a dozen multi serving packages to  compliment my emergency food storage.
review.name: Breakfast skillet

review.reviewBody: The classic Breakfast Skillet is a great delicious meal. It really is of great quality and also  quanity. It is enough to feed two people with one pouch. The only problem is the company has been shorting my orders lately, requiring you to open and count to make sure the correct amount of pouches were sent. Mountain House will send you the amount shorted but it requires calling them to complain and then waiting on another delivery.
review.name: A really great breakfast!~

review.reviewBody: This meal is amazing and my goto when im in the backcountry
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Exactly as good as you remember.  This is indeed the original recipe in a larger size.  Fantastic!
review.name: Delicious!

review.reviewBody: Great for camping and outdoor activities.Try to take with me every chance I get.
review.name: good healthy food, for on the run.

name: Breakfast Skillet

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Pro Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've been buying castelli free aero bibs for a few years now. I saw the negative reviews on this year's version and held off on buying for a while, but ultimately decided to try them. I took them on a typical 20 mile ride to test them out.

The good: same great chamois. Straps are very different and much improved, kind of more rigid like assos straps; they stay in place, don't fold up like the old straps, I think they are a huge improvement. The leg grip system seems about the same, but they stay down on my hairy legs a bit better (in past versions they stay put way better on shaved legs than hairy legs)

Ambivalent: material seems a hair thicker maybe? Compression is about the same.

The bad: they are indeed longer, now sit right above the knee. I have relatively long legs compared to my torso, and I wonder if someone who wears the same size with normal or shorter legs could have a problem with this. 

I did not experience any irritation of the seam on my skin like the other reviewer. I wonder if this is because of my relatively longer legs. Not sure. Regardless, overall I actually prefer this version of the free aero bibs compared to priors because of the straps.
review.name: Better than expected based on the review

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Pro Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: The chamois and resultant comfort are excellent. But, my 36" waist and 40" hips (I'm 5'9" and 185 lbs) really require an XXL size? But, hey, it's Euro sizing. Now for the fly in the ointment. The bibs have straps but no back panel. As a result trying to get these on results in twisted straps (think taking a strip of material until you've twisted into some sort of spiral) which are a PITA  to untwist so that the straps can fall flat against your back and shoulders. I love their fit and comfort but if I had known about the straps I would not have bought them.
review.name: A great bib ruined by one factor.

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Pro Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: The overall fit was pretty good, though the legs were a bit longer than normal and came just above the knee. However, the seems by the knee are very noticeable and started the chafe me after about an hour. After two hours I started to bleed a bit. The chamois is great, but the seams are a deal breaker.
review.name: Great chamois ruined by horrible seams

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Pro Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 5'7" and approx. 165Ibs or 75kilos. Slightly out of shape not avid spinning participant so I'd say I'm and average build. These shorts have a great shami but you need to go a size up from what your used to. I'm a medium and they were tight.
review.name: Fits Small Free Aero RC Pro Rib Shorts

name: Free Aero RC Pro Limited Edition Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Skratch Labs Hydration Sport Drink Mix - 20-Serving Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been loving all of the Skratch mixes for years! They taste great, don't upset my stomach, keep me hydrated, and make me feel better instantly after drinking. I love the Strawberry Lemonade, Lemon Lime, and Orange flavors, but was lucky enough to try one of the limited edition Cucumber Lime bags out and it has taken the cake for my #1 favorite. I love the Cucumber Lime Gatorade but this has a much better and more sweet taste.
review.name: My Go-To Hydration

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using the Skratch sport hydration drink mix for over a month for both training and racing and i’m impressed enough to have already placed another order. This seems to do a really good job at providing the right amount of ingredients to fight off the muscle cramps even in the brutal east coast summer. The raspberry lemonade is the only flavor I’ve tried so far but it’s great. Not overly sweet, no prolonged after taste, and no stomach disagreement.
review.name: A better hydration drink

review.reviewBody: Skratch Labs Hydration Drink Mix is my new running and paddleboarding BFF!  No more sugary drinks or stomach woes. This stuff keeps me hydrated, tastes great (real fruit flavors!), and the resealable pouch is super convenient. Totally rocks!
review.name: this stuff is terrific

review.reviewBody: Been using this product now for 2 years. I am hooked.
review.name: Continue to love

review.reviewBody: I am loving the hot apple cider from Scratch as I love all things from Scratch labs. By far my favorite hydration mix.
review.name: Hot Apple Cider is REALLY good

review.reviewBody: My husband and I love this drink mix! It's tasty and does the trick for re-hydrating after workouts in the Rocky Mountains. Lemon lime and Strawberry Lemonade are our favorites. I recently tried the Hot Apple Cider. While tasty, it doesn't mix as well as the others. I'll typically have a slurry of cinnamon and other spices at the bottom of my bottle which is sometimes off putting.
review.name: Love Skratch!

review.reviewBody: Not much more I can add beyond all the other positive reviews here, but I love this stuff. Definitely tastes better (more natural and a better flavor) than the other hydration mixes I've tried. Lemon-Lime is my favorite flavor, though Orange is pretty good and Matcha isn't bad. I'm not a fan of the Strawberry flavor, but that may just be me. And, Skratch is a great company made up of athletes like you and me. Well, maybe better than me, but you get the idea.
review.name: Simply the best

name: Hydration Sport Drink Mix - 20-Serving Bag

description: Buy the MSR Night Glow Zipper Pulls online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Night Glow Zipper Pulls
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Night Glow Zipper Pulls online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They are too small to absorb much light to see at night. They are too small to see at night. The glow last an insignificant time after being in daylight all day. I would not take them even as a free give away.
review.name: These are a joke.

review.reviewBody:
I can now find my phone in the dark; no more fumbling in the tent/camper/bedroom etc. Not that I'm one to ever have to fumble in the bedroom, tent, camper. Heehee.
Quality nylon mini-rope straps, well sunk into the small MSR tag.
Also helps to keep my phone from slipping away, off the couch, out of my pocket, onto the floor, over the cliff, etc. A useful and practical item indeed.
review.name: Much more useful than imagined.

review.reviewBody: Replaced a standard zipper pull on my daypack with this as it’s the pocket I use most often. Easy to find each time,
review.name: Strong and Bright

review.reviewBody: great pulls - ridiculously expensive for a piece of plastic with luminescent additive over molded with a piece of string attached! lots of competitive alternatives so I only use these for my winter hunting gear.
review.name: great pulls - ridiculously expensive

review.reviewBody: Work great and easy to find. Just bought more because my original ones that are 10+ years old are still glowing and preforming as they should!
review.name: Work great and easy to

review.reviewBody: Prefect to make getting out of the tent a little easier at night. Perfect glow to find the zippers super easily. Keep up the amazing quality and good work MSR!!!
review.name: Prefect to make getting out

review.reviewBody: Love these glow zipper pulls but when comparing the reflective properties to other utility rope, they should definitely be brighter. Please update in a revision!
review.name: Great for pack zipper pulls but reflective thread should be brighter

review.reviewBody: Love this product. I am addicted to the glow in the dark pulls. Don't forget to buy pulls for your Rain Fly and your tent. I put a set on my Feathered Friends Bag too.
review.name: Addicted

review.reviewBody: Cheap way to upgrade the functionality of your gear. I've got them on my tent and on some backpacks. No more searching for the zipper in the dark! 10/10
review.name: Upgrade!

review.reviewBody: If you lost a zipper pull or need when you don't want to turn on a light. Here you go. Can't speak to max glow duration.
review.name: They glow they can be pulled.

name: Night Glow Zipper Pulls

review.reviewBody:
If you have the short sleeve Responsibili-Ts, stick with the same sizing you have there. The shoulders / chest are built the same way, so if you have a preferred size, it should look roughly the same on you in the long-sleeve format.

I'm between a S and M for Patagonia (and normally wear Ms from other brands), and I love having this in M for the boxier / more relaxed fit. I could probably size down to S and still be fine, but I think Patagonia shirts look good either way!

Having worn this all winter and fall, I couldn't be happier with it.
review.name: Love it, fits like other Responsibili-Ts

review.reviewBody: Runs a little big, I enjoy the extra room, though! Just don't size up. Super comfy and cute! I preferred the men's style over the women's. I wear it all the time!
review.name: love it

review.reviewBody: The classic Patagonia long-sleeve tee. Very comfortable and true to size. I like the neck and cuffs. Stretchy enough to be comfortable and push up your sleeves but made well enough that they don’t completely stretch out and lose shape or fall down your arm.
review.name: The classic

review.reviewBody: The material is like workwear, heavy and scratchy.  I bought a medium after checking the other long sleeve t shirts I own and them all being medium.  My Patagonia vest is also a medium.  But, it fits like a large.  At least if the cuffs were tighter, maybe I could pull it off.  But, I’m like Alvin and the chipmunks in this thing.👎
review.name: Meh

review.reviewBody: Ordered the white one for my nephew.  It arrived and appeared grey in color.  The white was so dingy.  The front of the shirt also appeared pilled as if it had been worn.  I returned it immediately, of course on my own dime.
review.name: terrible product

review.reviewBody: Owing to its fabric from recycled bottles, this shirt is pretty robust; kinda on the cusp of a lightweight sweatshirt.  Seems like it would do well for Climbing by resisting the scuffs and scratches of rocks.  Yet it obviously makes a neat fashion statement.  Like a lot of Patagonia stuff, I find this shirt runs "trim" ; so I went up one size and was glad I did.  It's warmer than an equivalent cotton shirt, nice for chilly season now.  Well worth the price, in my opinion.
review.name: Interesting Weight = Interesting Perform

review.reviewBody: I got this as a gift. They love it. True to size, fits well.
review.name: Great gift

name: P-6 Logo Long-Sleeve Responsibili-T-Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Light, semi-modular, airy, what's not to love? Finally a helmet I can wear during more intense uphill efforts without cooking my lid.

However, this is small. In a Smith I'm a large with lots of room to spare, including a thick beanie. This helmet - I went L/XL (I think I'm roughly 57cm) - is just barely large enough to accommodate an ultrathin wool liner. The result is that it wears a little high, and if I had a 60cm head and/or any other hair in don't expect I'd be able to wear it.

Size up if it's an option, because it's otherwise a great piece of gear. Oh yeah, and it works well with a headlamp or goggles, if any of you reading reviews needed to hear that.
review.name: Great touring lid!

review.reviewBody: Smith helmets are generally too high-volume for me and this fits perfectly. I have only tried it biking so far and it stays put, feels light. I'm in AK so I don't mind that this is slightly less ventilated/warmer. Only con is that the visor is hard to adjust; you need 2 hands to do it, which is a terrible design. Smith visors are way better IMO
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for adventure racing, to hopefully use one helmet for multiple events. 

It's bulkier than I'm used to, but the fit and weight are great. I don't have a need for the quick goggle connect feature, but it seems cool for those who would use it.  Good purchase for someone trying to keep their gear weight or closet space more compact!

This seems like a nice helmet but the fit is different, at least for me. I ordered a L/XL which does fit my head for circumference, the issue is the depth or height of the helmet.  The thing sits on top of my head to the extent that any fall would probably twist the helmet off my head and choke me to death with the chin strap. I realize this is a triple certified helmet, bike, climb  and ski but I assumed there would be more lateral coverage for my head ( similar to a ski helmet) but at least the way it fit me you might be safe from a direct overhead hit but not much else.
It looks a good helmet if it fits your head.
review.name: Wanted to like it

review.reviewBody:
So far, so good! Been on a few backcountry ski tours with this helmet. Nice because it is lightweight and easy to stuff in the pack (or on outside of pack). Fits comfortably/securely and looks good as well. Also works well with sunglasses.

I have a head size slightly on the smaller side of Large with other helmets (can be a M or L helmet size depending on the make), and the L/XL in this Dynafit TLT helmet fits perfect. There is room for me to wear a thin or even medium thickness beanie underneath, by extending the rear adjustment piece down and cranking the adjustment wheel out. If you have a really large head, and want to wear a hat underneath, this helmet could be too small -- worth trying on first.

The triple rating is great for ski mountaineers who mike be on a bike approach, or dealing with some climbing/rappeling as well.
review.name: Solid lightweight helmet

review.reviewBody: This helmet is just perfect. Weight is low enough with enough airflow makes me forget that I am even wearing it. No complaints whatsoever, perfect skimo helmet
review.name: Perfect Helmet

review.reviewBody: Overall, the helmet is great. The only problem is the size. Previously, I used the RADICAL model and it was OK in size - even with a spare for a thick hat, this TLT, although the XL size is up to 61 cm, is much smaller - the shell arrangement is different. If you have a large head, this helmet will not fit - too bad ;(
review.name: Great helmet - size too small

review.reviewBody:
From skimo to alpine to MTB. Certified for all!

Raced in the Pierra Menta with it this year. Well vented and light.
review.name: Awesome multi-sport helmet

review.reviewBody: After 45 years of skiing, I finally wear a ski-certified helmet! I have been trying multiple ski helmets over the years and have always gone back to wearing climbing helmets for objective danger, however knowing that climbing helmets will not help my nugget if I fall and hit my head. TLT is a jackpot! light, packs easily, breathe, and fits well. Now I am actually wearing one in skiing almost on a daily basis! I use same helmet also for MTB and paragliding which means I just unloaded 3 unused helmets from my gear storage. Works also well with headlamps and sunglasses. Strong recommendation! Also, actual weight is 389g instead of 392g on the webpage, usually, manufacturers tend to pronounce lighter than real weight. not the case with Dynafit. My only worry is that with all the use I need to buy a new one soon :/ Lightest is not always most durable.
review.name: First helmet I actually wear whilst skiing

review.reviewBody: Is just there to fill-in the need. Nice-well fitted product.
review.name: Is just there, nice and fit

name: TLT Helmet

review.reviewBody:
I love this step.  It has two different angles you can set it for and it works great!  Be warned though that it may dent the metal right under the latch point.  Your car was not built with the intent to use something like this so all your weight is transferred to the car body and will most likely dent the metal.  Depending on which angle you choose, it will leave two indents.  I have attached pictures below.

I already have pinstripes from my adventures and this does not bother me, but making sure you all know what CAN happen.  If you don’t want to use this, you may want to look into getting a whittle wadder :)
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Love this step.  It has two angles which helps a lot.  The only thing you need to know is it will most likely leave a dent on your door frame.  My rig is already pinstriped from adventures, but this is a different marking.  Your weight on the car at this spot was not expected.  When you step on it, the weight is transferred to the point of contact and will most likely leave a dent under the door latch point.  If you are good with that, great!  If not, look into getting a whittle wadder instead :).
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This seems like a good idea but the weight it puts on the frame can damage your frame. It put a noticeable strain on my door hinge
review.name: Be careful could damage frame

Good size and shape, i ordered my first photochromic lens. They are not dark enough for full sun, and the change is slow so for fast moving trails, i find clear sight is difficult. 
Wish i'd ordered normal sunglasses as these come with a clear lens.

review.reviewBody: I have four pairs of “sporting” sunglasses and I reach for these almost every single time. I have the discontinued dusty blue with rose gold lenses and have used them in many light conditions. I do think my smith reverb glasses with red chromapop do a little better in and out of trees to cut glare, I’ll probably eventually get a set of red and set of black lenses for these. Sadly my rose gold are getting a few nicks. The only thing I wish they had was the adjustable nose piece like the reverb, but they stay on just fine.
review.name: Reach for them every time

review.reviewBody:
Visibilité par temps nuageux

review.reviewBody: I’m a Smith fan and these don’t disappoint! Great fit, great visibility ( I tried the over all lens in an overcast day and no problem). They also fit well with my helmet. Highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: Great fit, perfect running, biking companion, light and full vision.

review.reviewBody: I have been a Smith customers for over a decade. I bought a pair of Bobcats a year ago. They broke yesterday. They fell off my head and broke at the hinge. I ask Smith if I could purchase a new temple. They said no. Their warranty department makes it impossible to get items repaired. This product should not have broken so easy. Mountain biking glasses should be more durable. I am very disappointed.

review.reviewBody: I wear this hiking and climbing. It's perfect for the days you don’t really need a puffy but still want something. Super lightweight and very comfortable.
review.name: The perfect layer

review.reviewBody: I normally live in my arc'teryx jacket to run in during the spring/fall months but I have switched it out for this jacket. It blocks the wind while also being so breathable.  When I am trail running and the sun is beating down on me, I still feel fine to keep it on, but once I get higher elevations where it gets colder/windy, it protects against that chill. Just the perfect jacket to regulate body temperature during activity
review.name: My go-to running jacket

review.reviewBody: I love this windbreaker. It is just slightly larger and heavier than other wind shells when packed down into the chest pocket, but the stretchy and quiet fabric, functional hood, and two front hand pockets make the size and weight trade off more than worth it. It is still very packable. Also, it is the only windbreaker with long enough arms for me for biking!
review.name: Stretchy and quiet

review.reviewBody: This has been my favorite piece of gear for shoulder-season riding!  It packs up into its pocket and fits well in my hip pack & bike bottle cage - it's also been useful as an emergency shell during summer storms.  It's insanely breathable while still providing protection from wind and light rain!  The fabric is soft and super quiet - unlike most "wind" shells.  Could not recommend this enough!!!
review.name: Absolute necessity for your MTB hip pack

review.reviewBody: This is my new go to jacket for trail running, mtn biking, etc. The fabric is soft, quiet and breathable yet repels water. It's very comfortable and the fit makes it easy for movement. Hope more colors are added for next year!
review.name: Love this for Everything!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Metolius Rock Rings CNC 3D online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I got these Rock Rings for my boyfriend (and let's be honest, so I could use them :P). We've had them for about 5 months so far and they've been great. My initial impression of them were, holy crap, they're heavy! They're a little over 2.5 lbs each. They make your bag heavy but don't take up very much space so they're very portable.
We live in an apartment so he put them on his door frame mounted pull-up bar and just wrapped the rope around a couple times to make them hang higher off the ground. 
I've got tiny hands so the pockets are a bit deep for me to crimp, but I can use them as pretty much normal juggy closed hand holds. He has bigger hands but since the pockets are deep he has stated he uses them as jug holds as well. I often use these for off-set pull-ups to increase my finger strength, I'll hold on the very top which offers a jug hold with one hand and do 2 or 3 finger active hangs or pull ups with the other hand. 
Overall these have been a great addition to our at home climb training.
review.name: Heavy Duty

name: Rock Rings CNC 3D

review.reviewBody: I didn’t know I needed compression leggings until I tried these on. I love them. Well made and comfortable.
review.name: I want more!

review.reviewBody: Just like the description above says - very comfortable and flattering.  Sometimes the compression is too much.  Not here.  I am definitely buying another pair.  And made from recycled bottles is very cool.
review.name: These pants feel very good

review.reviewBody: Awesome pair of leggings. I had heard a lot of great things about Girlfriend Collective and decided to finally check it out.  I love the fabric, compressive but comfortable.  Great for yoga, hiking, and other workout classes.
review.name: Comfortable and Functional

review.reviewBody: As someone who used to exclusively buy leggings from brands like Old Navy... wow. These leggings are INCREDIBLY worth the money. The material, made from recycled plastic bottles so you can feel good about what you wear, is silky, smooth, and wrinkle free. But here's my favorite part about these leggings... I am tall and thin, my hips are wider than my waist. These leggings are a struggle to pull up over my hips, but then once they're on my waist, they fit perfectly!! I have never had a legging fit like this before. I've always had leggings that fit loosely around my waist or weren't as snug as I wanted them to be, but these leggings are it! I won't be buying any other brand from now on. Girlfriend, by giving me support in all the right places with your pants, you've won my unconditional support!
review.name: Actually fits my waist!

review.reviewBody: I love these leggings, and this brand for that matter. One of my girlfriends, no joke, introduced them to me and I've been adding girlfriend pieces to my collection ever since. I'm 5'8" and 180, I wear a large. I would say these are true to size and fit perfectly! Love the high rise, and the material doesn't pill. I have their leggings in multiple colors and styles, but the high rise compressive are my favorite. They're made from plastic water bottles, what more do you want?!
review.name: Amazing Fabric!

review.reviewBody: Amazing comfort that gives good shape, comfortable to wear both inside and outside
review.name: Best fit, great for all day

name: High-Rise Compressive Legging - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Shoe is rugged and stylish I was excited to match it up with my other outfits and gear. when I tried to put them on the shoe was hard and stiff. I wasn't sure where to place the inbuilt shoelace pull string. It seemed to get in the way of the wrap-around zipper closing which was very difficult to zip up smoothly. I was afraid it would break if forced. Overall looks sporty and rugged, but too stiff and zipper design needs a little more work. I'm a size 9.5 flatfooted woman.
review.name: Nice sporty rugged sneaker boot, but...

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Seeing other reviews worried me, but these are another great pair of zipped Terrex.  They are true to size, relatively easy to get on and the zip works well.  The velcro adds to the security at the ankle, but the zip alone is sufficient.
Stylish and smart, whilst another pair of easy -on/easy-off waterproof and warm boots.
review.name: Another great Terrex boot with zip

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
The design is really bad. The laces are bulky under when the zip is closed. It’s impossible to close the zip without putting something through to pull it. There is no strip at the heel to pull them off and on. The Velcro strip is unsuitable for a the amount of pressure that this area will take and I imagine will loss it stickiness and therefore gain a useless boot. 
Unfortunately I do not believe the designer have thought about the usage of this shoe and went for trying to look different when the the first version of this boot worked so well. 
I brought two pairs as sizing to compare the strange sizing and sent them back. Really disappointed and wish they would stick with something that looks great and works than trying to change it.
review.name: Such a disappointment and the side zip a mistake

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s well insulated and cushioned to keep feet warm and walking comfortably, especially in the snowing season.

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's

They aren’t meant for the cold but I live in Florida and have no issues with them being too hot. Will used them in colder weather down the road but could not be happier
review.name: My new go to hiking boots!

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Free Hiker 2 C.Rdy Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: 3L Hip Pack + 1.5L Bladder
hasVariant.description: Buy the Evoc 3L Hip Pack + 1.5L Bladder online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using a backpack w/3L hydration bladder for many years and decided to give the hip pack a shot for shorter/cooler rides.  I drink a lot when I ride and carry a ton of bike repair items, and a SPOT gps so I was worried about space.  The two side pockets took my multi tool, links, plug, and keys.  The spare tube and pump were a bit much so I ended up getting straps and keep those on the bike frame now.  The bladder when full takes up nearly all the space in the main compartment.  My SPOT fits in the front pouch without much room to spare.  Hydrapak bladders are always amazing, I won’t buy anything that doesn’t use this system.  My only complaint is the hose is about 1-2” short, I kinda have to tilt my head down to drink. If you have a tall torso this will be a problem and you’ll want to find a way to extend the hose.  The hose also has a magnet on it that securely keeps it at your side on the bag.  It took a few rides to blindly and quickly place the magnet after taking a drink, but like clipless pedals, it just takes some use to get it down subconsciously.  The other thing I like about using the hip pack is my back does not get drenched in sweat (as it does with a backpack), when riding in cold weather this keeps you much warmer.
review.name: Excellent for shorter rides

name: 3L Hip Pack + 1.5L Bladder

review.reviewBody: Love how the helmet feels. The adjustable boa helps for a firm fit. Very light can barely tell it’s there
review.name: Love how the helmet feels.

review.reviewBody: This product compares well against other backcountry helmets on paper (weight, features, etc). The quality is better than others I’ve tried. I use this for backcountry touring and really enjoy how the BOA tucks away. I’m usually a small women’s in Smith and the Small in this helmet fits tight enough when tightening the BOA. Minus one star because the Matte Poppy color is more of a salmon pink and not a red. This was disappointing. And, removable ear flaps would be nice for those cold mid-winter days.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to replace my smith mission which i was rocking without ear flaps for years for this purpose. 

+ folding boa adjustment is great. 

+edges are molded so they don’t delaminate like some others with heavy use. 

- chin strap situation flaps wildly at speed. Super annoying. 

- There is no goggle retention catch or clip (a vertically oriented bungee (like the side ones) would be sweet to keep the goggles straight. 

- headlamp slots and bungee attachments are gimmicky, but at least they don’t flop around or come undone. 

- mips is still awkward and unnecessary.
review.name: Lots of great features, but lacking some key ones

review.reviewBody: The helmet is quite large overall, does not feel trim. My biggest issue is that the tightening system/cables comes down below my ears so when I cinch down the helmet my ears get pinched and with a hat on, there is no adjustment. The dial feels like it sits awkwardly low on the back of my neck as well. The chin strap is also odd, and when tightened the buckle sits center under my chin and the pad does nothing. I really wanted to like this helmet, but it doesn’t seem like it was tested for fit on small -average women.
review.name: Odd Fit

review.reviewBody: What a huge disappointment. I wear a medium Vantage. It fits perfectly. What a great shell design. It's just what I wanted. However, the straps on the Summit are non-adjustable. No fore-aft chin strap adjustment is possible. Either the chin strap must be positioned too uncomfortably low, or the front temple straps will be too loose for a safe fit. Two 5g sliders plastic at the strap triangle would have eliminated this problem. In addition, the symmetrical l-r length of the strap triangles places the buckle too far toward center, making the chin strap pad useless. Unfortunately, the Summit fits a very specific head shape – but with non-adjustable straps, it isn't mine. Returned.
review.name: Non-adjustable straps. Really?

name: Summit Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: A must have on those trails and will hold lots of your treats and phone and drinks
review.name: Should of brought this sooner

review.reviewBody: I ordered an XS (clothing size 10) and it is perfect. Phone and keys in the front, and a 500ml soft flask in the back pocket was comfortable and stable. My gloves also fitted in the back pocket, and there is loads of space in both pockets for gels. I can envisage my jacket or gilet fitting thru the elastic loops as well, which will be a bonus. The snug fit meant it was a little difficult to reach into the rear pocket whilst I was running,  but that’s a small price to pay for the comfort and security.
review.name: Super comfortable and plenty of storage

review.reviewBody: Shouldn’t have discontinued Advanced Skin belt which was amazing and not bouncy. Can’t carry anything without this bouncing.
review.name: Too bouncy
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Great fit, snug, stays on, holds a lot of stuff in front and back. I don’t feel it when I’m running. I went with a M, I have a 34 waist & it’s 🙌🏽
review.name: Best running belt

review.reviewBody: Done a few runs with it now and it’s a great option when you don't wanna bring the vest. I find it a bit bouncy with a full flask in it, but not bad. I was between sizes and decided to go smaller. Feels comfortable. Overall, happy with the purchase.
review.name: Great Belt!

review.reviewBody: This is very handy for my short runs, 10Km. I have been using it for holding my phone and keys. No friction burns and fits very well. The fabric is excellent as I normally wear it underneath my t shirt.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: In the winter I usually have pockets to store anything I need on my runs but summer running clothing lacks those pockets. I was on the hunt for a waist pouch and realized all would likely bounce up and down and not be comfortable. This belt is wonderful! It stays in place and is very comfortable for a run. The pouch to put belongings is snug. I love it! Especially for summer running :-)
review.name: Summer phone holder!

review.reviewBody:
At 5'9" and 215 pounds, I'm a Clydesdale. Since becoming a hybrid athlete, I've been searching for something to carry my gear on everything from long Zone 2 runs to sprint sessions (Pixel 8 Pro phone, ID, first aid/blister kit and key.) This does it all.

Thank you Salomon for including larger runners in your sizing. This fits without chafing or binding, holds my gear securely, and breathes. I've tried a myriad of belts, bags, chest rigs and packs, but this has it all.
review.name: The Buck Stops Here

review.reviewBody: Plenty of room to carry in here. No zipper, which is preferable (one less thing to break!).
review.name: Simple, good product

review.reviewBody: It is not that good to store a flask with liquid. It is better to store buff or food. But definitely not heavy things.
review.name: Store light stuff

name: High Pulse Belt

description: Buy the Shimano XTR/Dura-Ace CN-HG901 11-Speed Chain online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: XTR/Dura-Ace CN-HG901 11-Speed Chain
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XTR/Dura-Ace CN-HG901 11-Speed Chain online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This chain is an excellent match for the Ultegra drivetrain.
review.name: Smooth and quiet shifting

review.reviewBody: New chain for your bike is like getting a new drive train for your car. Every rotation is smooth and glides like butter. I've ridden with Shimano Dura-Ace for decades. It's a reliable product and I trust purchasing components from reputable merchants like Competitive Cyclist.
review.name: Reliable and Very Satisfied

review.reviewBody:
You don't really think much about your chain, but there is nothing like a chain that works so well you forget about it.  Shimano chains just sorta work.  I know they test .5w faster on some marginal gains gizmo that has a margin of error greater than they are measuring, but I'm more looking for something that just works.  

Shimano chains, on their drivetrain parts, are incredible.  Under load, spinning fast, whatever, they just work and I'm good with it.

I'm a chain waxer as well, and they do seem to last many thousands of miles.  My one bike that doesn't get bad weather has gone closer to 5000 miles before I decided to change it.  It didn't seem possible and I changed it out of paranoia.  

More expensive, but there's a reason they cost more, it's not just fluff.
review.name: They're the best

review.reviewBody: Great buy, vs Amazon's fake one. Legit Real Shimano Dura Ace
review.name: Real

review.reviewBody: I have only used the chain for a few weeks so I do not know how long it’ll last, which is a huge factor. The performance is great, probably the best I’ve used.
review.name: Great performance

review.reviewBody: This is not my first time using this chain and I’ve never had any issues using them for thousands of miles on paved and gravel roads.  This is a light Shimano chain that is easy to size and install.  Reportedly rates well in terms of decreased friction, saving a little over one watt in tests.  You do pay for these benefits however.
review.name: Light, durable, and watt-saving

review.reviewBody:
Get them new.  Clean them thoroughly and use a wax based lube.  

Go Fast.
review.name: Top of the Line

name: XTR/Dura-Ace CN-HG901 11-Speed Chain

review.reviewBody: After the shock of spending $44 on some grips I took these out for a 3 hour ride. Climbing they felt ok, but descending these are absolute craps. Maybe am used to my plush thick DMR brendog grips but these left my hands and palms in major discomfort. I have to stop a few times just to give my hands a break. Total waste of money.
review.name: Why even have grips at all

review.reviewBody: These grips are comfortable and look good, but aren't too durable. One of the first rides I took on them I set the bike down (not hard) and the plastic insert and end cap broke. Sadly, it's not just cosmetic - with the plastic sleeve broken, the grip doesn't sit right on the bar and feels goofy. Too bad that a grip that costs so much is so wimpy! I'll probably just replace them with a more durable, and affordable, option.
review.name: Broken already

name: GE1 Evo Factory Grip

review.name: love, love, love this cart!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's as if Bote knew exactly what I need before I do. This is the perfect answer to easily getting my kayak and gear to the river, plus I can use it on my Jeep hitch to carry extra bulky stuff to bluegrass festivals and to the beach. Brilliant
review.name: Outstanding product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very useful device and very well put together. Received it much quicker than I thought I would. My only criticism of this car is that you should use standard rod holders on the side so other things out there would fit in them. Good example beach chair rack all the beach chair racks out there have basically a 1.75 inch outer diameter for a normal 2 inch rod holder. Yours is only inch and 5/8 in inner diameter so nothing out there really fits.
review.name: Pretty cool little cart

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The cart is beautiful, well-designed, and sturdy. I was surprised with how little it moves around on the trailer hitch. The packaging was solid as well, it was well protected for transportation, and arrived in great condition. Have not got to put it on the beach yet but look forward to using it.
review.name: Quality look and build

review.reviewBody:
Fantastic cart. I’m now a 1 trip dad (from truck to beach) instead of a 3 trip dad (going back n forth) 
Only thing I would say is getting it on and off the hitch/receiver is really quite the struggle. Is there anything you can spray in hitch/receiver to help? 
Any way to stop the guessing game of the holes lining up? 

I would still buy the cart again. It’s great. Any advice on the issues I have would only make it that much better.
review.name: Great Overall

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cart is so well designed and rugged! It carry’s so much more gear than my old beach cart. And I love that it can be carried on the hitch. Super convenient.
review.name: This cart is so well

review.reviewBody: Would love to have an electric bike attachment + umbrella attachment then it would be perfect!
review.name: ATTACHMENT

review.reviewBody: Terrific product - Overbuilt! Will last for many years to come!
review.name: MULE Cart

review.reviewBody: Bought 1 month ago and have used 3x in snow when hiking. Am fully satisfied w/ performance: Water resistant, easy on/ off, effective clasp grasps onto shoe laces. Worn on my ankle high hiking boots with snow cleats- was having the problem of occasional tripping when shoe lace bow looped hooked onto other boot lace hook or the snow cleat of the opposite foot. Hear gators also prevent that problem because they cover the boot lace hooks and laces.
review.name: Low Gators

review.reviewBody: Great summer low gaiters. Durable and perfect size to keep rocks and debris out of your boots during the summer treks
review.name: Gaiters

review.reviewBody: I haven't used them on the trail yet but they seem nice enough so far.
review.name: Seem solid so far

review.reviewBody: I just got these this winter to keep snow and rock out of my ankles on hikes. I think they fit great around my shoe and leg, and have done their job well thus far! They go on super quick and I like that they hook on to your laces in the front. They may look slightly puffy, but not ridiculous by any means.
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for!

review.reviewBody: I bought these recently so I have a short height version to complement my full height version and these are terrible. There is either a defect in the cut of the material or there is a defect in the design. They fit like balloons around my ankles and there is no way to cinch them tight higher up on my calves in order to try to pull them up. Never mind how silly they look but from a practical perspective, there's no doubt these would get caught on something on the trail which in my view renders them useless. I'm a big fan and supporter of OR products but this product is a dud. I don't recommend these.
review.name: Fit like balloons around my ankles

review.reviewBody: I carry this in my regular hiking pack because they are small, easy to put on & quick my boots & plans dry & clear of sticking plants
review.name: Quick easy carry-along

review.reviewBody: Industry standard for quality gaiters.
review.name: No haters, these are the gaiters

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Immediately used these in very muddy terrain. Extremely happy with this purchase as these are perfect for the warmer seasons and has enough coverage to protect against all kinds of stuff entering into the boots. This was a great purchase and will get an incredible amount of use.
review.name: Perfect for warmer seasons

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Gaiters fit well and did a good job sealing off my ankles. Very well made. Look like they can take abuse.
review.name: Very well made

review.reviewBody: Unless you are wearing several pairs of pants under these, consider the sizing way off. These should fit close to your skin/pants so that there are no gaps to let stuff in (while comfortable and not suffocating your leg). Instead, if you trust in the chart and have average sized calves, there will be an enormous gap between your legs and the elasticized band, rendering these useless. If you don't want to waste your time or pay return shipping, consider their sizing chart wrong and misleading - I hope that you read these reviews before ordering!
review.name: HUGE - SIZING WAY OFF SO USELESS

review.reviewBody: one of the softest bouldering shoes I've tried and i love it. they are comparable to the Scarpa Drago but less aggressive, less asymmetric, and less expensive which is a plus. I like to do comp style boulders with lots of volume so having a soft shoe that is able to smear is a must. Plus the sticky rubber makes me confident that i will not slip on any volume. But if i wanted to edge with these shoes on tiny holds, i would pick another shoes, say my flagship, because the super soft rubber is super sensitive and feels uncomfortable on small foot holds and being so flexible makes it so i really have to use my feet muscles to stand on the holds. I am a size US men's 8 and i downsized them half a size (7.5) to get a more performance fit and they fit perfectly. the split tongue of the shoe makes it so you can slip in and out super easily which i love so much, i wish they had these in other shoes.
review.name: great indoor comp bouldering shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Solazo Down Vest - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Hard to beat the price of this with the sale price discounted even further. You won't find a better value for the money. The vest's color blocking is a Cotopaxi trademark, and it's very stylish. The cut is slimmer than the North Face Nuptse  -- there may be a slight taper in the lower section. While this is super warm and light with big down baffles, the slimmer fit limits the layering opetions somewhat. You could fit a hoodie or light fleece under it, but for me it was a little tighter at the waistline than I deally like in a down vest. I'm, 6' 2". 220# with a slim build and I ordered the XL. If you don't have an athletic or slim build, it may be too tight in your normal size. On the plus side, even though this is a large baffle vest, it looks ever so slightly less-puffy than the Nuptse.

The collar and shoulders/upper chest and back have an abrasion-resistant material, while the rest of it is smooth nylon.  I think there may be a DWR coating on this part. This aids in wind- and rain resistance, as well as increased durability under a pack. The pockets zip with a flap cover, which is nice. There's a drawcord hem. Besides the slimmer cut, the Solazo lacks the inner wind flap of the Nuptse. A minor detail, but possibly some wind could get through the zipper opening in especially gusty conditions. In terms of manufacturing, it's easily made as well as the TNF or Marmot equivalents, with the color-blocking being the highlight feature. 

Though this was a lot of price/performance bang at the super sale price, I ended up returning mine because I also ordered a Nuptse and a Marmot Guides vest, and couldn't see myself wearing it all that often. But the quality factor is high here, and it has standout style.  Design-wise, the only thing I would add is a wind flap under the zipper, but I can only surmise this was an intentional omission by Cotopaxi.  Even though mine went back, I still have to give it a 5-star review.
review.name: Excellent down vest

review.reviewBody: Fits quite well and well built to last long. Love the warmth it provides in the cold northeast weather.
review.name: Comfortable fit

review.reviewBody:
Exceptional service!!
Bought lots and great service!!

Long term customer!!
review.name: Great service

review.reviewBody: Lightweight but warm. Good quality, great color options.
review.name: Great quality vest

review.reviewBody: Very puffy and very cozy. Really enjoy the vest. A little long for me but I just sinch the bottom.
review.name: Puffy and cozy

review.reviewBody: I wear large in the down jacket. So I brought a L, size vest & had returned it for a medium. I think a vest should be a little snugged rather than a little loose like a jacket / coat! Great choice u did going with the medium size vest. Also great quality from Cotopaxi!😁
review.name: I wear large in the

review.reviewBody: I bought this on a whim because I was taking a few winter courses and I swear it is one of the warmest articles of clothing I have ever owned, the downs loft is impressive and keeps me warm while I'm skiing in the backcountry
review.name: Solano Down Vest

review.reviewBody: It was eyeballing some expensive down vests from companies that charge multiples of this Cotopaxi sale vest. I saved myself some money and bought this one, and am grateful that I did. I’m 5’10”, 165 lbs, with a fit build and a wide back. This thing fits like a glove. Not too loose, not too tight. Just right. It’s very warm, and snug enough I can wear it as a layering piece too. The torso is a little long, which is great for body coverage, but I could see some people feeling it runs long. Overall an A++ purchase. I wires it today in New England in the low 30s when running to and from the car, and was quite content in it.
review.name: Fantastic vest at better price

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased the cavern/chestnut color. The fit is true to size and materials feel well made. I am 5'7 and chest size is 37-38 and M fits really well. It definitely has enough room to wear a sweater under which is great. The vest is a little on the longer size for me but I don't mind it as much and it does have a cinch to tighten it. Overall I love this vest and the color was a must have for me.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my husband and he literally never takes it off. It’s his new favorite piece of clothing- he tried to even justify wearing it for an interview….
review.name: Great purchase

name: Solazo Down Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased this after borrowing the unisex version for carrying my 30lb toddler. I was very skeptical of the "women's fit" (why would I want narrower straps?) and bought this one only because it was less expensive and I am a cheapskate. However, it's great! I am 5'5", so not super petite, but i have a smaller frame. This one is way more comfortable for me. Can't even put my finger on what it is exactly - but the weight distribution is better, and I feel more balanced when standing/walking. My kid is somehow up higher relative to me than he was in the unisex version, even when it was adjusted in the same way. I totally recommend it if you have a woman's body or if you are just a shorter/smaller person.
review.name: So much better than the unisex one

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag after owning the standard version of deuter child carrier for it’s adjustability. My husband is 6’3” and I am 5’0” and 115lbs, so we needed something that we could both wear. It worked alright, but as our family grew we needed two carriers to keep hiking. This one is SO much more comfortable for me. I was even able to carry our 20lb toddler while 8 months pregnant comfortably. Would not have been able to do that in the standard carrier. If you are short and or slim, THIS is the carrier for you.
review.name: Perfect

name: Kid Comfort Active SL Carrier

hasVariant.name: Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody: My gear got a little wet when canoeing,no water in bottom of canoe just splash from paddle.Every thing else was great especially the zipper.
review.name: Water resistant

review.reviewBody: First thing I’ll say is that the zippers are the smoothest on any duffle (or other things too) I have ever used. Strange comment, but they’re really nice. Materials are strong enough and not overly heavy, and I’ll fit in a LOT of gear for my next big adventure. Straps well thought out, I look forward to taking this along and creating big memories.
review.name: Fantastic bag

review.reviewBody: Great bag for long trips. We bought these for our scouts going to the National Jamboree this year. Love the.
review.name: Scout Jambo Bag

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to use it much yet, but it's huge, which is what I was looking for.  The zipper set up is great because you have tons of access to what's inside.  I plan to use it for checking a bunch of fly rods (along with other stuff) for a saltwater trip.  FYI it's 31.5" inside dimension fits most rod tubes for a 4-piece, 9 foot rod.
review.name: Fits fly rod tubes

review.reviewBody: Perfect size and sturdy for long expedition. Fits my 50L pack and all the gear!
review.name: Excellent expedition duffel!

review.reviewBody: Better than I thought it would be. I almost bought one of the Amy’s but I’m glad I didn’t, and save some money.
review.name: Very nice bag. Colors stand out too.

review.reviewBody: Enough room for my gear , I always look for extra room and this bag is taking the job very seriously.
review.name: Travel

review.reviewBody: Loved this duffle, it is large and holds tons of gear while maintaining a couple of pockets and finner details. The material is light for this type of duffle which I appreciate. Aditionally the strap system is practical and really easy to latch on-off and adjust. Great piece of gear for anyone!
review.name: Large, tough and light hauler duffle!

review.reviewBody: Great quality as always!!  I have several MH bags and duffels I have accumulated over the years and they never disappoint!!
review.name: Awesome bag

review.reviewBody: Easy to pack and haul. This is a no nonsense duffel with external backpack straps. Meaning, this is a one large volume container, except for the end pocket (which is also used to store the duffel when not in use). A small zippered pocket also exists on the inside cover. It is a good size for the 50 pound airline limit and seems to hold up to inadequate baggage handling.
review.name: Great duffel

name: Camp 4 135L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought it for my husband and it is more of a slim fit.
review.name: Not for someone with a belly

review.reviewBody: I had purchased other fleece jackets from another retailer over the past 2 decades and wanted to try something else. Backcountry usually has a wide variety of clothing items so I decided to start my search here. I did not realize that this jacket contained wool when I ordered it and initially I thought that it would be too heavy for my intended use (Spring and Fall in Colorado), however, after wearing it in temps in the 50-60 degree range, I decided to keep it. I ordered the large since the XL was not in stock and it fits fine without binding anywhere. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase and the 4 star rating relates to a shipping snafu, not the product which is 5*s.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I had the predecessors to this sweater for six years before my wife destroyed it in a washing machine accident. Was my favorite sweater for outdoor activities. So far I like this new version even better. It keeps me warm but not sweaty across a range of activity levels. It does run large and it is thick. The lining allows it to slide well over flannel.
review.name: Warm breathable sweater

review.reviewBody: Not soft enough. Doesn’t stay close to the body when you move or raise your arms. Bulging a bit along the zipper. Maybe it’s ok as an outer layer, but not as a fleece sweater. Good quality otherwise.
review.name: Too stiff

review.reviewBody: Thicker and warmer than a standard lightweight fleece.  Runs slightly large.  If you’re on the edge between sizes, order the smaller size.  Very warm, thicker fleece.  Maneuverability is good for the thickness of the jacket, but not as good as some of the more lighter weight fleeces.  Only have had it for 2 weeks, so not sure on durability yet.
review.name: Great jacket, warmer, heavier fleece

review.reviewBody: Literally exceeded all expectations. This might become my most favorite Kuhl sweater ever...it certainly looks as though it will last me several years. It is slightly larger size-wise and much thicker than the interceptr. It's advertised as ski wear, but I live in the Pacific Northwest, and while I don't ski, this will be a go-to piece on many a chilly evening come winter. I think it looks great too (my wife agrees). Sure, a pocket for the phone would have been nice, but I don't feel I have any room for complaint -- it's a great sweater at a very reasonable price. Super satisfied.
review.name: Amazing

name: Thor Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: These fit perfectly; comfortable, cool, soft, feel like air. They wash nicely and I hope will last. They appear delicate but most definitely durable.  I made a small investment in numerous pairs and was initially nervous but now very happy with my purchase. They are expensive but well worth the price. I highly recommend.  I would definitely purchase more when needed, no matter the cost. You get what you pay for !!!
review.name: Best boxers ever !!!

review.reviewBody: This will be my second season using these.  I just bought another pair! They are very comfortable and at 1.8oz, it's really kind of hard to beat...if you're looking for lightweight, durable gear.  I carry these while thruhiking, and I have yet to find a lighter merino boxer brief.  Would recommend to anyone trying to go UL.
review.name: Lightest Merino  boxer brief' I'v found!

review.reviewBody: I'm on my 6th or 7th pair starting 12 years ago. 4 hanging in closet. All I wear when it's below 40/45 and I live in MI so that's a lot. Like pajamas but sturdy, water resistant, stretch waist etc. Wish they'd go on sale once in awhile but don't. Well worth the price.
review.name: Best winter pant

review.reviewBody: After guiding in these pants for about a month now, they have become my favorite cold weather pants. They are comfortable and plenty warm for freezing days on the water.
review.name: Favorite Cold Weather Pants

review.reviewBody: I'm in Montana right now (last week of March 2024). The first couple days were in the low 20's and snowing. I wore them with silk weight long underwear and my legs were never cold. Great pants
review.name: Warm in Montana

review.reviewBody: Not enough room in the butt and thighs. Common theme in Simms pants.
review.name: Don???t love the fit.

review.reviewBody: So much better than the old fleece pants I used to wear. These are nice looking and warm!
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my husband for fishing. He LOVES them and keeps telling his buddies about them. They keep him warm and comfortable.
review.name: Quality warm fishing pants

review.reviewBody: Barely warm enough at 30 degrees and no wind. And feel very cheaply made--don't feel like they're going to last. Glad I didn't pay full price . . .
review.name: Not real warm for outdoors

review.reviewBody: We miss the taupe colored warm simms pants. My husband normally wears a medium, but these were too big nice warm pants though.

Pant are good quality and they would definitely do the job ‘ but unfortunately like so many pants now made have a low rise and are not comfortable for my body configuration.  If they were made to fit at the true waist, I’m sure they be ok
review.name: Low rise

review.reviewBody: No zipper pockets. Every pant should have a back zipper pocket and a side zippered pocket.
review.name: Good Cold Weather Option

name: Cold Weather Pant - Men's

These are like those but with primaloft so my toes stay warm. The only con is that you can’t adjust boa dials with the shoe covers on. description: Buy the Osprey Packs UNLTD AntiGravity 64L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: UNLTD AntiGravity 64L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs UNLTD AntiGravity 64L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pack! This is the only pack I own for extended backpacking trips that does not hurt either my shoulders or hips. When I used this pack, I was carrying 35 pounds of gear and it didn’t feel like I was. I have an arthritic back and this pack has been the only pack that doesn’t aggravate my back. I would recommend this pack for anyone looking for a pack that has the same issue. It’s well worth the price if you are in the same situation.
review.name: I love this pack! This

review.reviewBody: My husband and I both have these. He scored his on sale for 50% off at a local gear store and I got mine on sale here. Probably not worth the non-sale price. I upgraded from a 54 L backpack to this and it truly is comfortable! I was previously wearing an older Osprey Atmos. I love the clamshell opening for packing purposes AND for accessing your gear on the trail. I got a really nice fit and never had any pain in my hip bones or my shoulders.
review.name: Really feels like nothing on your back

name: UNLTD AntiGravity 64L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Oh boy do these pedals make a difference. I started off with those crappy plastic pedals and once I saw the price on these, I had to try them out. My feet feel glued to the pedals and I didn't feel any bouncing at all during a DH ride over rocks and roots.
review.name: Great first upgrade to any trail bike

review.reviewBody: Very nice pedals a nice red color, and pretty durable which i hit on bigger rocks here and there, and the panels are grippy!
review.name: Mtb pedals

review.reviewBody: I'm more of a roadie so I'm used to clipping-in. However, after buying a new MTB and hitting the local trails, I discovered that maybe flats would be better at least until I get used to some of the more technical sections. I stumbled onto these and they work perfectly. Makes tackling that uphill rock garden a little less stressful. Plus, they come in orange.
review.name: Inspire confidence

review.reviewBody: Seriously best flat MTB pedal I've ever used. I've tried other brands and I've tried clips but honestly these are hands down my favorite pedals to use when ripping some single track or downhill lines. Love LOVE love. Hubby and I both love these and wont go to a different brand, quality is just beyond phenomenal and will handle smashes against rock that are bound to happen from time to time and I love the size of the platform I feel so secure on these bad boys. Seriously why are you still reading reviews.. BUY THESE you wont be dissapointed!
review.name: Dont think, BUY THESE NOW

review.reviewBody: These are great pedals for the price, I had tons of hard rock strikes with my old pedals. These give me a little more clearance. Some of the rock gardens on the trails I ride just whack a pedal even when I do my best, it happens occasionally
review.name: Best flat pedals I've had

review.reviewBody: I love these so much. Right they are favorite pedal.
review.name: Great For The Trail

review.reviewBody: These pedals rock. I have had mine for 2 years now and have contemplated switching to different pedals several times but always decided to stick with these! AMAZING GRIP! I have never slipped off, always feel locked in and ready to rip. The scrapped and banged them on rocks and have never lost a pin or broken the pedals. Super strong and durable, and also light weight. Overall, 10/10. I just ordered my wife a bike and bought these same pedals for her because I don't trust anything else.
review.name: Don't want to use anything else

review.reviewBody: Solid peddle for the price. Keep your feet locked in!
review.name: Awesome value

review.reviewBody: Replace stock pedals for these and what a difference.  Grips good on my Vans and any shoe with a soft sole. Highly Recommend for the beginner and Advanced.
review.name: Better Grip and feel!

review.reviewBody: I rode these pedals on a friend's mountain bike and had to get them for my own. They are strong, smooth and grippy - especially when paired with MTB shoes (I have the five ten freeriders).
review.name: Great value and great pedal

name: Chester Pedal

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Hoodie - Women's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the Pata Capilene Hoody - have owned several over the years. This iteration feels lighter than last year and provides great protection. I like mine a little loose, for air flow and movement, so the medium fits me well (my normal Patagonia size). The only complaint I ever have with most tech tops is odor retention, but I’m also not expecting to smell like roses when roaming around the Sierra on long adventures. Highly recommend this top!
review.name: A+ Sierra Hoody

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Hoodie - Women's
review.reviewBody: What a great shirt! It was so soft and so comfortable to wear. It kept me dry during my hike. The weather was a little cool but the shirt did it’s thing. It was a perfect shirt for what I needed it for and I really like the color.
review.name: So soft & so comfortable!

name: Capilene Cool Daily Graphic Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: I am a bald dude that wears a hat every day and this is by far my favorite hat- fit and style- that I have owned in a while. My main complaint is that I have owned it less than two months and it is already very faded. I bought the green one, so I don't know if the other colors fade as quickly
review.name: I love this hat but...

review.reviewBody: I love these OR hats that have the non ridged brims. This hat fits a little larger than a normal dad cap would fit on my head. I do love that this has a 360 degree wicking sweatband. This makes it a good high activity as well as casual around the town hat. I have been wearing it religiously the last week.
review.name: Fun hat!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Nuun Endurance Hydration Drink Mix online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Despite the current unpopularity of added sugar in anything, nuun endurance is made for times when consuming simple carbs helps way more than it hurts. I find stevia, sorbitol, etc. which are in most other electrolyte mixes (in lieu of the added sugar) to be hard on my stomach, but this product sits very well with me. If you struggle to digest solid food while exerting yourself this product is for you. I just wished more stores carried it.
review.name: Awesome!

name: Endurance Hydration Drink Mix

review.reviewBody: This was a replacement shoe for a defective pair of hiking shoes. I needed something for winter, so these fit the bill. I bought a one-half size larger based on my experience with my other Salomon shoe. Fits well and is perfect for my need. The colour of the shoe does not match the photo. The actual colour is a light shade; more yellow than brown.
review.name: Replacement shoe

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable and warm, i ordered 11.5, it felt a little tight since i wear thicker socks for winter... so i've just ordered 12 for a better fit! I'd recommend getting .5 bigger than usual fit!
review.name: Very nice, maybe ½ short

review.reviewBody: I wore these boots for a month. Quite warm and comfortable. The size was perfect.
review.name: Good shoes for winter

review.reviewBody: I bought these about 2 months ago.  Super warm and dry.  I would recommend one size up like all my Salomons
review.name: Super warm

review.reviewBody: I bought the Outchil as a winter boot to fish in the cooler weather.  Great product. Light weight. The toe box was a little tighter than the 4WD boots that I routinely wear. I recommend upsizing 1/2 to 1 full size.
review.name: I really like the boot and the light weight..

review.reviewBody: Nice looking boots, and fit my quite wide feet nicely. The loop at the back helps pull them on, but is a bit bigger than ideal. They are indeed fairly warm, but I haven't yet got to test properly their waterproofness - and importantly, whether they remain waterproof after a few months.
review.name: Comfortable fit on wide-ish feet.

name: Outchill Thinsulate ClimaSalomon Boot - Men's

description: Buy the The North Face Trail Lite Sleeping Bag: 35F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trail Lite Sleeping Bag: 35F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Trail Lite Sleeping Bag: 35F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace my summer bag. I'm a very hot sleeper( i like it cold) go winter camping all the time. But I'm not using this for winter. It has a comfort rating of 39, a limit of 29, and a extreme limit of 1F. Took it on a month long hiking trip and when the nights started hitting around 45-40 I got cold WITH a Thermolite liner. The nights that were around 35 I had to use my liner, full wool layer, and fleece layer on my legs to stay warm. In addition to that the draw string cinch button is so small and useless you basically just have to pull and force it. It also has the other hallmarks of a crappy bag such as an annoying zipper and did not stop leaking down the entire trip. Very regrettable purchase. My last few north face buys have been bad. The products didn't last long but at least they performed. This doesn't perform and won't last long due to the leaking.
review.name: Worst. Northface Purchase. Ever.

review.reviewBody: I am an avid car camper and bought this for my summer adventures in the back of my car. Although athletically it looks nice, it is not warm for summer nights. I found myself very cold at night after my first time using it and had to pack spare blankets for extra warmth. Also, I don't like how it does not zip down so your feet are trapped at the bottom.
review.name: Would not buy again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] very good warm and light
review.name: i like it

name: Trail Lite Sleeping Bag: 35F Down

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are well constructed, but the wide shoes aren’t wide. They are not built for a full grown man’s  feet and therefore feel like women’s shoes. Stop with the unisex sizing, it doesn’t work. 

The high tops are wider than the low tops.
review.name: Wide shoes aren’t wide.

review.reviewBody: The shoes are really nice, pretty and you can really tell that are wider than a normal NB shoe. Perfect in my opinion.
review.name: Very very nice product

review.reviewBody: Even if you are normal width, opt for the wide sizes. As someone with a wide foot this particular shoe is narrow compared to New Balance’s other shoes.
review.name: Too narrow in width

review.reviewBody: Definitely fit smaller then all the trail runner and running shoes ive tried. 11 wide in every pair of new balance I've had over the last 10 years. Wish there was an Xtra wide in these, tight and not that comfortable
review.name: Fits tighter/slimmer

review.reviewBody: Nice fit and look- solid fit all around great shoe
review.name: All around great

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoes and look great. Go half a size down, they run big.
review.name: Great but run big

review.reviewBody: I don’t think I bought a pair of new balances in 30+ years. After using all of the other brands for years, I was surprised to see the quality of new balances. My small grip is that these are wide fit shoes, but the tongue has an elastic strap that’s a bit tight initially. IMy small grip is that these are wide fit shoes, but the tongue has an elastic strap that’s a bit tight initially. I’m sure it will loosen overtime.
review.name: Really well made

review.reviewBody: A little tight but look great. Should have bought 10.5
review.name: Good purchase

review.reviewBody: Love the style and fit, lots of compliments! Went with wides this time and much better. Have similar pair not wide and they are tight fitting.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Unisex design not the best for guys. I couldn't get my foot into it despite this being my size. Called NB and they said because the design is unisex, that actual dimensions of the shoe were a little different. If you are a guy and actually into sports, your foot might also not fit in this shoe.
review.name: Unisex design means not sized for athletic males

name: Numeric 440v2 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Usually get 4 a season lately, used daily for securing skis to patrol sled, rope's and bamboo, maybe using four together to improvise a toboggan strap, extra splint immobilizer,if you had to it could probably be used as a tourniquet or 2. Many uses, also use them during Summer securing cord's and air hoses. You could probably make a belt by attaching 4 or 5 together.

review.reviewBody: Different style than normal, but soo comfy.  The drop seat is a game changer! (you can literally squat and pull them down like shorts!  Light material, comes up high in front, love handle area has different seams, which makes it comfortable, but it does show a mild underwear line. Legs had a great material, but not supper grippy. Chaomis: 9/10. Wider width in the butt area, and V area on the more, average thickness. My only real critique is that it DIGS into your underarms if you have any sort of chest/shoulders. You can even tell on the model in the picutre I returned it hopeful that a larger size will work better.
review.name: complete review

review.reviewBody:
I?ve tried all different brands of dropper bibs. These are spot on for me. Great fit, design and chamois. The  construction of the dropper function is much more solid than the other brands. No uncomfortable zippers or weird combinations of mesh and straps that are given to ripping when you actually need to drop. 

I like a longer length leg and these are perfect in that regard too.
review.name: Great dropper bibs!

name: Pro SL Bib Short - Women's
