review.reviewBody: Cool look. Very durable. Arch support almost none.
review.name: FYI. TRY IT FIRST

review.reviewBody: Just bought my 3rd pair. Easy to put on and take off, comfortable and decent longevity for the price of the shoe. I wear a size 9 for sneakers but, I go up a 1/2 size for the Chameleon 8. Perfect fit for me.
review.name: Men's Chameleon 8 Stretch

review.reviewBody: I've used Merrell while on deployments to Afghanistan and walked mountains in them. You try a lot of boots when you're young, impressionable, and have footwear options. Merrills were the battalion favorite for walking all over the mountains. These did not disappoint and in fact, I did notice a positive performance change when wearing them. I put a lot of miles on these boots in full combat gear and after eleven years, I've still been coming to Merrell for their boots (these specifically) to hike with the family in. Thank you Merrill.
review.name: Dependable

review.reviewBody: nice mid slip on, good support, ok lacing(speed) system. Great vibram sole
review.name: nice shoes

review.reviewBody: Ive had 6 pairs of Chameleons, love them! Hot, cold , wet and dirty they hold up!
review.name: Best day to day all purpose!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable out of the box. Good tread on the soles for mixed terrain. Convenient slip on for an old man with a bad back that struggles to bend over and tie laces on bad days!
review.name: Highly recommend
comment: Thanks for the great feedback and recommendation!

review.reviewBody: I have purchased around 50 pairs of these shoes. I buy 7 per year. I will be DEVASTATED if they stop producing this shoe.
review.name: I have bought over 50 pairs

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a pair of these for 3 years and they have been everywhere, hiking, mtb, motorcycle touring.  Probably ranks in my top ten.  I’m 60 so had a lot of shoes.
review.name: Slip on, traction, breathable

review.reviewBody: I am a house painter in Florida. This shoe has been my go to for years. It fits my foot like a glove as well as giving me the support that I need. Nice job!

I've been buying chameleons for years. One of the most comfortable shoes I've put on my foot. I wear them for everyday and every occasion. I walk my dogs 5+ miles everyday through all kinds of terrain. I get about 6 months out of the soles. They are easy on easy off. And fit me like a glove.
review.name: Love my chameleons.

name: Chameleon 8 Stretch Hiking Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Zephir Altitude Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Zephir Altitude Harness
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Zephir Altitude Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Zephir Altitude Harness
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Zephir Altitude Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve used numerous harnesses for Mountaineering and so far this is my favorite. It’s light, easily adjustible, comfortable, and has enough attachments points to carry the essentials.
review.name: Fantastic alpine harness

review.reviewBody:
Very lightweight and comfortable to wear while climbing and scrambling. Not the most comfortable when belaying or repelling, but that's to be expected given the lightweight construction and lack of padding. the leg snaps and waist connector are easy to use and lock securely. I do wish it had a haul loop or additional gear loop.  
it's a great alpine harness when you won't be hauling a lot of pro, or for glacier travel.

Have used other light weight harnesses especially BD. While they have served great and fine but needed more security for glacial peaks & mountains like Denali and Rainier. The solid loops to hang carabiners gives that peace of mind. Bottomline - lightest and strongest in the market. Petzel Altitude comes right close but I like Mammut colors as they are visible in whiteout or glacial peaks like Denali, Rainier, 8000m,.
review.name: Excellent product for alpine climbing and mountaineering

review.reviewBody:
Easy to put on without needing to step through the leg loops. Quite comfortable for an alpine harness too. The gear loops are nice and beefy, but it might be nice if the ice clipper slots were a little further away from them.
All in all though I really like the harness. My only real issue is that I lost a couple inches on my waistline in training and now the hard point on the waist belt doesn't line up. Need to size down.
review.name: Good alpine harness

review.reviewBody: I bought this originally for rescue in my job as a ski patroller and have found myself bringing it on every ski touring trip where I may need a harness instead of my BD Couloir. While the Mammut does not pack down as small it is more robust and comfortable. The small bit of extra size and weight is negligible in my opinion.
review.name: More comfortable than other ski harnesses

review.reviewBody: Just used this climbing mt hood, did great. I love that you don't have to take off skis to put it on.
Very Happy with this harness. I used it while ski mountaineering and it was great.
review.name: Great Harness!

review.reviewBody: Perfect harness for ski mountaineering. Lightweight, reasonably comfortable (wouldn't want to hang for too long in it), and very easy to get on/off with skis on.
review.name: Idea for ski mountaineering

review.reviewBody: I used this climbing Denali in 2022. The harness was very easy to take on and off. The only thing I wish it had was a second set of gear loops along the back.
review.name: Great touring harness!

review.reviewBody: Good quality.. light.minimalist. Easy on with boots and winter cloths
review.name: Light and simple. Easy on with boots

name: Zephir Altitude Harness

review.reviewBody: This chain breaker came in a kit that i used for traveling.  I like the chain breaker so much that i pulled out of my travel kit and is now my go to chain breaker in the shop.  Used it for several years never had a problem.  I have used it on single speed, 11 and 12 speed Shimano and SRAM chains.  Can’t say if it will work with SRAM AXS 12 spd road chains as i have not used it on that yet.
review.name: Breaks Chains simple as that

review.reviewBody: 2nd time using it, tip broke off making the tool useless.
review.name: Look elsewhere

review.reviewBody: These are reliable and convenient to use. Switching between straps made easy.
review.name: Reliable and convenient

review.reviewBody: I love that I can quickly switch from my different straps, bags and cameras, depending on my needs or moods
review.name: Love theses

review.reviewBody: I've bought anchor packs before -- this time I got a surprise. Inside the cardboard package was this little clear bag with two small oval split-rings and two little black sleeves to slip over them -- along with a specialized tool with which to install the split-rings. These are the ultimate in design efficiency, being big enough to provide an articulated connection point that won't wear out the anchor loop and small enough not to make any superfluous noise on the camera body. Freakin' genius.
review.name: Now with Cool Split-rings!

review.reviewBody: These little mounting tabs are small but sturdy. Easy to change yo another product as needed but priced to have them on every bag you use.
review.name: Inconspicuous and Strong

review.reviewBody: I received these anchors to replace the defective ones included in the Peak Design recall.
review.name: Compact and efficient

review.reviewBody: This anchor system is ground breaking, made 3rd party companies utilize it. I love it, but they should consider making a slightly thinner loop strings
review.name: Ground breaking

review.reviewBody: I love the anchor links and use them all over the place. They have held heavy cameras, bags, and other gear. I think I have had anchors since they first came out and they are still going strong.
review.name: So very useful

review.reviewBody: Perfect idea, great quality, these are now another part of my PD collection, helps hake life easy when changing over cameras
review.name: Perfect idea, great quality

review.reviewBody: Paired with the camera strap, these are great. I have them on my tech pouch, my light weight packing cubes, and my drone controller. Its a super versatile setup, and the strap is always super comfortable.
review.name: These things are awesome!

review.reviewBody: I have a handful of these and sometimes when I buy a bag I discover that I can attach a couple and increase the use of the bag. Awesome product as usual.
review.name: Bag Insurance

name: Micro Anchor - 4-Pack

review.reviewBody: I normally use Tenaya Ras for gym days but I wanted a tighter fit for more performance. Good luck finding Tenaya shoes to try on anywhere. So I went through a bunch of different shoes and landed on the Scarpa Vapor V for a few reasons. They fit my toes properly. Some shoe brands kill my toes because my second is longer than my big toe. I love my TC pros for outdoor slab and crack climbing — especially edging. I wanted a shoe with XS edge soles. These fit the bill perfectly! Finally I wanted a slight down turn and if I curl my feet as I put them in and Velcro up, they stay snug and give me great toe pressure for tiny edges. Love these shoes!
review.name: Favorite shoe for gym climbing

review.reviewBody:
These shoes don't need breaking-in.

In terms of other qualities -- edging on small foot chips, feel/sensitivity -- these seem to be middle-of-the-road.  For example, the Miura seems stiffer and can hold tiny edges better. The Quantix seem softer and gives you a bit better feel. The Skwama seems to be similarly comfortable for wide-ish feet, but these are less aggressive. 

These are definitley my go-to for comfort without significant compromise in performance. The rubber may wear slightly more quickly but I believe this is the price you pay for softer compounds. I am on my seoncd pair, but plan to re-sole them eventually. I wear these in my street shoes size.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I got these shoes expecting top quality shoes, but with in a month and a half they were already breaking down. The rubber is just not durable. When I talked to customer service they said that this was normal. To say the least I'm not thrilled with these shoes.
review.name: Not good quality
comment: That can be very normal. Rubber being really sticky and also being really tough/durable are 2 things which are generally at odds. It also depends on how you are using them. I just ran through the 3rd resole on mine in about a month of heavy climbing at a gym we joined. The walls basically have rough sandpaper on them (so you can smear with the cheapest shoes?), and I haven't been precise enough with my footwork. At my old gym they would last at least 6 months, but yea, no sandpaper on the walls.

Dealing with the same issue. I've owned them since October and I'm already contemplating sending them in for a resole. Rubber did not last very long at all. Disappointing cause they're pretty comfortable for what they are.

review.reviewBody:
At first i thought I had gotten the wrong size as they seemed just too tight! But after a few gym sessions in, they really fit like a glove and am not complaining at all! Super comfortable after the break in period and there is no air gap at all. The toe box and heel cup are snug like a glove. 

Just the right amount of downturn for most routes. They have good sensitivity and smear very well as they are soft. Not the best for bouldering but they will be able to work!
review.name: Painful at first but fits like a glove!

review.reviewBody:
I've had several models of Scarpa and other brands. These broke in quickly; I wore them for about 15 minutes a few days before climbing.

At the climbing gym, we climbed for about three hours. These shoes gave me a noticeably good footing on even the tiniest foot chips. Presently, I have serious climber's elbow in my right arm and mild climber's elbow in my left but nearly sent a 5.12a on my first attempt and I credit that to the difference these shoes made. That, and I used the Theraband Flexbar between each climb. But the shoes were just amazing.

After three hours slab bouldering, steep wall bouldering, roofing, and toproping, I removed the shoes and had no blisters or other issues.

These are worth every penny!
review.name: Excellent climbing shoes

review.reviewBody: The shorts are very comfortable but the grey is see through which is disappointing as they are more expensive than other brands.
review.name: Comfortable but see through

review.reviewBody: Great for under dresses and super comfy - I’d really recommend although would size up as on right side
review.name: Comfy cotton shorts

review.reviewBody: I wanted to buy the shorts to wear underneath dresses and skirts for the summer, but the fabric doesn't look like it would last long
review.name: Nice colour, fabric thin
comment:
Hi there,

A massive thank you for taking time out of your day to leave us feedback.

We’re so sorry to hear that our Sunrays Seamless Shorts weren't as thick as you’d hoped. We’re listening, learning and constantly striving to be better. We will make sure to pass this onto the relevant team.

Should you require any further assistance, our Customer Care Team would be more than happy to help.

Best wishes,
Team SB

review.reviewBody: So these are completely see-thru. Super comfy. Bought with the matching cropped top. The top is a much much thicker material (maybe double thickness) so you cannot see anything through it. But the bottoms are very thin and I can literally see my knickers straight through them. Luckily these are for lounging round the house in. Could maybe get away with a long tee or jumper if I need to nip out but 100% cannot wear as a set in summer with nothing covering my bottom! It’s a shame they are not double layered like the top!
review.name: See-Thru

review.reviewBody:
I bought these in a size XL as I’m a size 12/14 but currently pregnant and growing a big bump!
These shorts are so comfortable even with my expanding tummy. They don’t roll down but equally don’t leave a red mark at the top of the waistband like others do, as there’s no seams and a lovely amount of stretch.
Will be getting the vest to match and hoping there’s more colours released soon!
review.name: Seamless shorts - so comfy!

name: Sunrays Seamless Short - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I live in Wisconsin and I've worn the jacket for most of the winter days. I'm only 5'3 so I'm okay with the length (more like a cropped top) of the jacket itself as well as the sleeves. It pairs well with high waist pants. Super cute. 
Sizing wise, I'm 5'3, 110 lbs. Usually an XS in Patagonia tops, and got an S for this jacket. Fits well with a thick sweatshirt or hoodie under it. 
Have worn it out to walk in the snow for about half an hour and it stayed dry. I find this jacket warm in as low as 20 degrees.
review.name: Cute, comfy and warm!

review.reviewBody: Super cute and warm. Runs a bit small. I went 1sz up
review.name: Super cute!

review.reviewBody: I got a Large size and it fit everywhere but the waist, where it was apparently stitched for Marilyn Monroe or a corseted Victorian. I've never had a jacket fit so weirdly before. My partner tried it on and echoed that it has very strange proportions. Too bad; it's cute otherwise.
review.name: Weird sizing

review.reviewBody: Loved the jacket for its warmth and perfect length. Had to return though because the collar was so stiff and uncomfortable around the neck. The hood is removable thus eliminating the stiff collar but I wanted a jacket with a hood.
review.name: Stiff Collar

review.reviewBody: Purchased as a gift and was a perfect fit and the recipient LOVED IT!  Description was spot on. Back Country had it to me in banner time
review.name: Down Drift perfect

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket sort of on a whim when it went on sale and I'm so glad I did! It is so cute, I love the color, and it's warm without being stifling (I live in the PNW so anything toooo warm and I'm sweating). I have other more technical downs but I like that this is a warm, cute, around-the-town jacket. 
Patagonia usually fits me slightly on the smaller side (I'm usually an M but sometimes their Ms are small for me in the shoulders) but this jacket feels like it fits true to size! 

Definitely recommend! If I had the budget, I'd buy it in all the colors!
review.name: Obsessed - so versatile

review.reviewBody:
I got this jacket on a whim before a recent trip to Italy and Malta. The forecast ranged from low 30's to mid 50's with hard rain and extreme wind....this jacket put up with ALL of it! Not to mention I took various trains and planes, and even 2 boats - this jacket perfomed well above my expectations. Also, it was so easy to travel with! I never felt bulky or like I couldnt move around. It kept me warm, dry, and shielded me from strong winds.

This is quite possibly the best jacket I have ever owned, and I have had Canada Goose, Arcteryx, Northface, you name it.

This is an amazing jacket!
review.name: Best Jacket I have ever owned

name: Downdrift Jacket - Women's

comment: We are so sorry your package was lost in transit, we have issued you a refund for these.  If we can help with any other shoes to replace these, please let us know!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are awesome! They are perfect for scrambles and light east soloing or tough approaches. They also make a really good hiking shoe but i wouldn't want to do anymore then 4 to 5 miles as they don't have that much padding.  All in all a great shoe that does everything it says.
review.name: Amazing Grip

review.reviewBody: Great hiking shoes that double as mtn biking shoes.  fit is great for mid =width foot
review.name: Solidly constructed, stable and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I wear it daily indoors and out. Very comfortable and so far durable. Great for hiking or daily wear.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I like these. I haven’t had a chance to really test them in the elements yet, however, so far they are very comfortable. They do make you want to walk so standing isn’t the best as they feel like they push you forward, which is what they are meant to do.
review.name: Comfortable and ready to move.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable fit (particular to your foot, I know, but fits me very well; narrow foot); good traction; rain and splashed water does not enter through the fabric.  Easy on and easy off. Good looking enough for regular use and my go-to for air travel.  Billed as an approach shoe, which it serves well as, and also great as a day hiker, for scrambling on rock, and striding through airports.  It is my only shoe when traveling.
review.name: The full package

review.reviewBody: On my 2nd pair, usually last me about 18 months of fast roping, climbing, CQB work. My favorite pair of shoes for any job I do tactically.
Hikes and climbs great

This has been the one show that I purchase on sale or full price. Again, it does me, but it does all the things I want it to. It hikes, scrambles and is tough enough to withstand my wear and tear. I go through multiple pairs of shoes a year.
review.name: If it fits!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and really well made footwear

review.itemreviewed: MTB Comp BOA Lady Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had no idea the difference a shoe could make. After trying on maybe 10 pairs in stores from popular brands, I ordered a few from backcountry from brands that didn't seem to be in local stores. I wear an 8.5 narrow shoe in street shoes. These were the only pair that were not too wide. They were also so comfortable I feel like I'm riding a different bike. No pain points and just smooth sailing.
review.name: Felt like riding a new bike

review.itemreviewed: MTB Comp BOA Lady Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Believe true to size on length, seemed tight on 5th toe.  Did read and material is Urethane, so a shoe stretcher was applied and I sat the shoes on the dashboard of the car on a 90 degree day in sun for several hours, tightened the stretcher, another couple hours.  Seems to have done the trick.  Maybe extra 1.5mm across toe, no affect to heal.  Left toe velcro very loose and the boa still tightens the top of shoe fine.  I did use my personal shimano footbeds over the factory.  These aren't very stiff, which I desired. I wanted to be able to walk in grocery stores, or hike sidewalks, etc... I removed the plastic spikes and had my husband fill with a simple button plastic from hardware store.  They are cute, I like them, the blue is nice and holds color well.  Wet cloth cleans them.   Cleats adjusted as expected and I have no issues.  Just might note the tightness if you have "wider", I'd argue normal width feet.  For reference, I  wear Dalbello Kyra ski boots of appropriate length and the width is fine, and those are tight fitting by design also.
review.name: Womens Scott Comp Boa MTB shoe

review.itemreviewed: MTB Comp BOA Lady Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
There are a lot of good mountain bike shoes out there, but the trick is finding the one that fits your foot the best.  After trying like 10 different shoes, this one was the winner in terms of comfort, durability, and price.  This shoe is secure on my heel and midfoot, which is important for the inevitable hike a bike.  Most importantly, the toes box has plenty of room both horizontally and vertically to accommodate foot swelling.  My previous shoes did not have enough vertical space and when my feet would swell slightly several hours into a ride, they felt squished and uncomfortable.  These are comfortable all day!

The loops that the boa cord go through are reinforced with plastic and seem more durable than other similar shoes that did not have that plastic reinforcement.  The boa seems to be part of most mountain bike shoes now and it really is the best.  Perfect custom fit every time whether you need them snug or loose.
review.name: Very comfortable and functional shoe

review.itemreviewed: MTB Comp BOA Lady Cycling Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes!  Comfortable right out of the box -- If my feet hurt in cycling shoes before I even get on the bike, it's not a good thing!  This was the fourth pair of cycling shoes I tried in recent weeks and these are the winners! Although I will be using them for road biking, and they are technically MTB shoes, they are perfect -- still stiff enough for good pedal power -- not clunky or heavy, good grip on surfaces, stylish looks, even arch support -- well worth the price!
review.name: Finally, a cycling shoe I love!
comment: What size are you normally in US sizing? I have a pair fo 39.5 Fizik shoes, but they are definitely too big. Wanting to try these but not sure on sizing as I'm usually a size 8 for the most part.

name: MTB Comp BOA Lady Cycling Shoe - Women's
